pr_title: Remove unneeded paging when using PanacheQuery

timeline.bodyText: Well that's a change in behaviour: we used to have a single page encompassing all results. Perhaps it's fine, but at the very least, this has to be mentioned in the javadocs for the PanacheQuery interface.
timeline.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText: Javadoc updated, Noticed too that there is another interface ReactivePanacheQuery that has the same behaviour, so I updated it too so all three of them match.
replies.author: robmv

timeline.bodyText: This worries me a bit, why is it needed and where is it stopped?
timeline.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText:
As ProdModeTest build a small JAR and run the test on a different JVM, There is a need to start the H2 Database server, My question to @geoand that I will detail later is about this, The workaround to start it manually is because the ProdModeTest isn't starting it even when I am adding TestResources that has the @QuarkusTestResource(H2DatabaseTestResource.class) annotation
As a temporary workaround didn't closed it myself because it is closed when that specific test JVM is closed.
replies.author: robmv

replies.bodyText: Yeah, the prod mode test doesn't handle resources...
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: We could make it handle them for sure, but currently it doesn't.
replies.author: geoand

timeline.message:
Remove unneeded paging when using *PanacheQuery

Avoid setting paging information on the native query implementation when
no paging has been set on PanacheQuery and ReactivePanacheQuery
